page.title: 07Changing Times In Otley.
page.content: Otley started as a small community ar- ound the river.Victorian Era came and the present bridge was built.The previous bridge was destroyed by floods and rebuilt in 1675.The Grammar school was built in 1611 in Manor Sqaure but is now in Farnley Lane. The Poor House was moved from Cross Green in 1873 and an Imfirmary added in 1907. By Benjamin Rhodes. New estates have been built like Riverside in the mid-1970's.The Whartons Middle School was built in 1975.The market is known to have been attended and maintained for 700 years. In the last 70 years many Inns have disappeared e.g.The Grey Horse.The post of Town Crier has recently been re-established. by David Dickerson & Kevin Townend.
